title: worldofcoins
author: worldofcoins
created_time: September 16, 2023, 03:46:08 PMLast edit: November 20, 2023, 08:02:06 PM by worldofcoins
content: /]Website"[banned site]" is the best IP Stresser / DDoS tool, with Powerful Layer 4 and Layer 7 Bypass methods."[banned site]" seeks members to promote their service on the forum.Campaign Rules- A maximum of 25 posts/week will be paid.- No minimum posts /week- Posts made in Off-Topic, Games and Rounds, Bounty Threads, Lending section, and where the signature is not displayed will not be counted.- Posts should be 100 characters minimum. Low-quality posts will not be counted.- Enrolling with Alt Account(s) is forbidden.- You cannot Enroll if you've valid negative (-ve) Tags/Flags against you by any DT-1, DT-2 Member(s).- A minimum of 5 Earned Merits in the past 120 days are required to participate in the campaign.- After acceptance (Avatar, Signature & Personal Text) must be worn within 24 hours.- Removing/Changing the signature while in the Campaign will result in disqualification, and you will have to re-apply if you want to join again.- I reserve the right to kick you out for any valid misconduct done by you and deny the payment.- Another week will not start unless I announce. Once started, it will be paid without any Delay.- Week will start on Friday and end on Thursday (Forum's time)- AI-generated content isn't valid and will not be paid. It will get you removed from the campaign.Pay rates for Ranks(4x) Full-Member Rank: 1$ /Post(4x) Senior: 1.5$ /Post(4x) Hero & Legendary Rank: 2$ /PostApplication formCode:Username:Profile-Link:Rank:BTC Address (Segwit):Post-Count:Merits Earned (Last 120 Days):Spreadsheet

Are the funds escrowed?I can't tell how long it will last, but the funds are escrowed with me, enough to cover for 6x Participants, considering they all make 25 posts/week.

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: Quote from: worldofcoins on September 16, 2023, 04:16:57 PMQuote from: coupable on September 16, 2023, 04:10:25 PMCan you tell how long this campaign will last? And how much funds in the campaign pool? Are the funds escrowed?I can't tell how long it will last, but the funds are escrowed with me, enough to cover for 6x Participants, considering they all make 25 posts/week.For how long? I think there is no problem to share with us escrow address or just share it with few reputable members, right?Quote from: worldofcoins on September 16, 2023, 04:16:57 PMQuote from: coupable on September 16, 2023, 04:10:25 PMIs this campaign promoting the same old service stresser.net : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5413927.0No, this is a different service.As i can see from the website, the campaign is about to promote a service specialized in managing Ddos attacks. We all know that Ddos attacks are illegal (correct me if am wrong) and it's the reason why the old website stresser.net was seized by FBI. So if it's not the same service then it's an identical copy of it.According to FBI ; Anyone operating or utilizing a DDoS service is subject to investigation, prosecution, and other law enforcement action:Quote from: https://www.fbi.gov/contact-us/field-offices/anchorage/fbi-intensify-efforts-to-combat-illegal-ddos-attacksBooter and stresser services are a form of DDoS-for-hire—advertised in forum communications and available on websites or Dark Web marketplaces—offering malicious actors the ability to attack any Internet-connected target. These services are obtained through a monetary transaction, usually in the form of online payment services or virtual currency. Some criminal actors running booter and stresser services also sell access to DDoS botnets. These DDoS botnets are networks of malware-infected computers exploited to make a victim server or network resource unavailable by overloading the device with massive amounts of fake or illegitimate traffic.These services have no legitimate use; they are designed to overwhelm server resources or to exceed bandwidth capacities. Established booter and stresser services offer a convenient means for malicious actors to conduct DDoS attacks by allowing such actors to pay for an existing network of infected devices, rather than creating their own. Booter and stresser services may also obscure attribution of DDoS activity.Regardless of whether someone launches a DDoS attack using their own command-and-control infrastructure (e.g., a botnet) or hires a booter and stresser service to conduct an attack, their transmission of a program, information, code, or command to a protected computer is illegal and may result in criminal charges.
